qas.question: Where do State Banquets take place?
In what month does the Queen entertain the diplomatic corps?
What is used to set the dining table for formal dinners?
When was the Grand Service made?
For whom was the Grand Service made?
Where do state banquets take place?

answers.text: the first evening of a state visit by a foreign head of state

qas.question: What is the dining table laid with for state banquets?
Who was the Grand Service originally made for?
What month does the Queen promote the diplomatic corps?
What is used to set the dining table for casual dinners?
When was the Grand Service removed?

plausible_answers.text: the first evening of a state visit by a foreign head of state

context: State banquets also take place <a5_0>in <a0_0><b9_0>the Ballroom<b9_0/><a5_0/><a0_0/>; these formal dinners are held on <a6_0><b13_0>the first evening of a state visit by a foreign head of state<b13_0/><a6_0/>. On these occasions, for up to 170 guests in formal "white tie and decorations", including tiaras, the dining table is laid with <a2_0><a7_0><b11_0>the Grand Service<b11_0/><a7_0/><a2_0/>, a collection of silver-gilt plate made in <a3_0><b12_0>1811<b12_0/><a3_0/> for <a4_0>the <a8_0>Prince of Wales<a8_0/><a4_0/>, later George IV. The largest and most formal reception at Buckingham Palace takes place every <a1_0><b10_0>November<b10_0/><a1_0/> when the Queen entertains members of the diplomatic corps. On this grand occasion, all the state rooms are in use, as the royal family proceed through them, beginning at the great north doors of the Picture Gallery. As Nash had envisaged, all the large, double-mirrored doors stand open, reflecting the numerous crystal chandeliers and sconces, creating a deliberate optical illusion of space and light.
